qas.question: How did Dominic inspire his followers?

answers.text: with loyalty to learning and virtue

qas.question: How did Dominic not inspire his followers?

context: Dominic inspired his followers <a0_0><b4_0>with loyalty to learning and virtue<b4_0/><a0_0/>, a deep recognition of the spiritual power of worldly deprivation and the religious state, and a <b5_0>highly developed<b5_0/> governmental structure. At the same time, <b6_0>Dominic<b6_0/> inspired the members of his order to develop <a3_0>a "mixed" spirituality<a3_0/>. They were both active in preaching, and contemplative in study, prayer and meditation. The brethren of the <b7_0>Dominican Order<b7_0/> were urban and learned, as well as contemplative and mystical in their spirituality. While these traits had an impact on the women of the order, the <a1_0>nuns<a1_0/> especially absorbed the latter characteristics and made those characteristics their own. In <a2_0><b8_0>England<b8_0/><a2_0/>, the Dominican nuns blended these elements with the defining characteristics of English Dominican spirituality and created a spirituality and collective personality that set them apart.
